isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Front Cover, Vibration Damper, Oil Pump, and Cooling System - Removal

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, make sure engine has cooled before removing components.
To prevent personal injury or death, do not open pressurized Freon® lines.
To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).
To prevent personal injury or death, disconnect the main battery negative terminal before disconnecting or connecting electrical components.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner, and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

regulation.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids and filters according to applicable regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers or bodies of water.

step1.para: Before removing vibration damper, measure damper runout as follows:

step2.para: Remove paint from face of vibration damper at four points approximately 90° apart.

Attach a dial indicator with magnetic base
to front of crankcase. Position indicator tip onto an unpainted surface.
Pry crankshaft forward and zero the dial indicator. This becomes the baseline.

note.para: Pry only in one direction to eliminate possible error induced by crankshaft end play.

step2.para: Turn crankshaft 90°. Pry crankshaft forward and record reading.
Repeat at each unpainted surface. If run out exceeds specification , replace vibration damper.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, support the vibration damper during mounting bolt removal. The damper can easily slide off the end of the crankshaft.

step1.para: Remove and discard the four bolts (M12 x 59) that secure vibration damper to crankshaft. The vibration damper retaining bolts are not reusable.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not immerse damper in petroleum based solvents. Damage to rubber damping element may result.
